usefulItems: ice cube tray, cling film, freezer
title: Soya Milk Ice Cream

ingredients.content: roasted soybean flour, to taste (see tip) (optional)

preparations.content: Place soya milk, cream, sugar and egg yolks in mixing bowl then cook <b>8 min/90Â°C/speed 2<b>. Pour into an ice cube tray and leave to cool slightly. Once cooled, cover with cling film and freeze for at least 10 hours.

Place half the soya milk ice cubes in mixing bowl and crush <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then, with aid of spatula, blend <b>30 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a serving bowl.

Place remaining soya milk ice cubes in mixing bowl and crush <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then, with aid of spatula, blend <b>30 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to bowl with reserved ice cream. Serve with roasted soybean flour (if using) to taste.

hintsAndTricks: Substitute soya milk with dairy-free milk of choice, such as almond milk or rice milk.

Roasted soybean flour, also know as kinako, is a finely-ground powder made from roasted soybeans. It has a warm, toasted and nutty aroma, slightly reminiscent of roasted peanuts. It can be found in oriental supermarkets or online.
Blackstrap molasses is the syrup produced after the third boiling of the juice from mature or green sugar cane plants. It is more bitter than "regular" molasses and has a rich, robust flavour.
Before serving, place ice cream in freezer for <b>15 minutes<b> for a smoother texture.
